alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 9:11PM MST until July 31 at 10:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MST/1130 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO AND NAVAJO COUNTIES... At 907 PM MST /1007 PM MDT/, National Weather Service Cedar City Doppler radar indicated that much of the earlier heavy rainfall has moved north into Utah. However, as much as 2.5 inches of rain has already fallen, especially in the Navajo Creek basin and area washes and creeks are likely still running very high. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Labyrinth Canyon and Lake Powell. This includes the following slot canyons... Butterfly Canyon, West Canyon Creek, Canyon X and Labyrinth Canyon. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Peach Wash, Chaiyahi Creek, Antelope Creek, Last Chance Creek, Navajo Creek, Kaibito Creek, West Canyon Creek and Sand Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
